dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...so, like, another vaccine update, I guess. Groundbreaking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so, like, another vaccine update, I guess. Groundbreaking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but wait, this is Pfizer. Their CEO, Albert Bourla, he actually laid out a timeline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but wait, this is Pfizer. Their C E O, Albert Bourla, he actually laid out a timeline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizers CEO Albert Bourla said the company would file for emergency approval as soon as safety data is available, assuming those results are positive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A timeline that, uh, still puts it well past the election. Shocker.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A timeline that, uh, still puts it well past the election. Shocker.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the timeline makes it unlikely that the U.S. will have a vaccine before the election but leaves open the possibility of one being authorized this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but he said they'll apply for emergency approval in late November. That's, like, concrete.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but he said they'll apply for emergency approval in late November. That's, like, concrete.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer will apply to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for emergency approval of its Covid-19 vaccine in the third week of November, its CEO said Friday

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Concrete *if* the trials are positive. And *if* the FDA agrees, which, you know, takes time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Concrete if the trials are positive. And if the F D A agrees, which, you know, takes time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer will apply to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for emergency approval of its Covid-19 vaccine in the third week of November, its CEO said Friday, assuming it receives positive results from its ongoing trial

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: True, but he mentioned these "internal projections" that, um, first doses could be for frontline workers by December 1st.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but he mentioned these internal projections that, um, first doses could be for frontline workers by December first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Internal projections." Right. And "promising results in the elderly population." Sounds like a lot of hopeful guessing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Internal projections. Right. And promising results in the elderly population. Sounds like a lot of hopeful guessing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, but December 1st, that's... that's a date! For frontline workers!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, but December first, that's... that's a date! For frontline workers!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's a potential date, based on, what, a hopeful rumor? C'mon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a potential date, based on, what, a hopeful rumor? C'mon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He's just trying to, like, manage expectations against all the political noise, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's just trying to, like, manage expectations against all the political noise, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pfizer and other vaccine-makers have grown increasingly frustrated with the persistent politicization of potential Covid-19 vaccines by high-ranking officials... Bourlas letter does little to hide this annoyance,stating: To ensure public trust and clear up a great deal of confusion, I believe it is essential for the public to understand our estimated timelines

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, he's creating *more* noise with these kinda vague, hyped-up details.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, he's creating more noise with these kinda vague, hyped-up details.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He also said BioNTech's CEO, um, hinted at even *more aggressive* timelines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He also said BioNTech's C E O, um, hinted at even more aggressive timelines.

dialogue_turns.text: Aggressive. Great. More speed, less safety, I'm sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Aggressive. Great. More speed, less safety, I'm sure.

dialogue_turns.text: No, but he wants to ensure public trust, Host_A! He said it's essential for people to understand the timelines.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To ensure public trust and clear up a great deal of confusion, I believe it is essential for the public to understand our estimated timelines for each of these three areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The *estimated* timelines. There's a difference. Big one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The estimated timelines. There's a difference. Big one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bourla said the November timeline reflects the companys best estimates, noting that this could change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Still, it's, uh, progress. It's moving forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, it's, uh, progress. It's moving forward.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Moving forward to a highly anticipated... *maybe* by next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Moving forward to a highly anticipated... maybe by next year.

dialogue_turns.text: You're so cynical, but this is like, *the* vaccine!
